tests.name: 2023 USEF Second Level Test 1

test_info.trot_sitting_requirement: All trot work must be done sitting

tests.purpose: To confirm that the horse demonstrates correct basics, and now begins to accept more weight on the hindquarters as the collected and medium gaits develop. A greater degree of straightness, suppleness, throughness, and balance are required to perform the movements with ease and self-carriage.
tests.introduces: Walk-canter transitions; collected and medium trot and canter; 10m circle at canter; shoulder-in; rein back

movements.movement: Enter collected trot, Halt, salute, Proceed collected trot
movements.directive: Engagement, uphill balance and quality of trot; clear, balanced transitions; straightness; attentiveness; immobility (min. 3 seconds)

movements.movement: Track left, Change rein medium trot, Collected trot
movements.directive: Bend and balance in turns; moderate lengthening of frame and stride with engagement, elasticity, suspension, straightness and uphill balance

movements.movement: Transitions H and P, Collected trot
movements.directive: Clear, balanced transitions; consistent tempo; quality of trot
Angle, bend and balance; engagement and quality of trot
Angle, bend and balance; engagement and quality of trot

movements.movement: Halt, rein back 3 to 4 steps, Proceed medium walk
movements.directive: Immobility; willing steps back with correct rhythm and count; straightness; clear transitions
Regularity, quality, overtrack

movements.movement: Change rein free walk, Medium walk
movements.directive: Regularity, overtrack, and quality of walks; reach and ground cover of free walk allowing complete freedom to stretch the neck forward and downward; straightness; clear, balanced transitions
Clear, balanced straight transition; regularity and quality of canter
Moderate lengthening of frame and stride with engagement, elasticity, suspension, straightness and uphill balance; consistent tempo; clear balanced transitions
Regularity and quality of canter; shape and size of circle; bend; balance
Regularity, quality and balance of canter; straightness
Regularity and quality of gaits; clear, balanced transitions
Clear, balanced straight transition; regularity and quality of gaits
Moderate lengthening of frame and stride with engagement, elasticity, suspension, straightness and uphill balance; consistent tempo; clear balanced transitions
Regularity and quality of canter; shape and size of circle; bend; balance
Regularity, quality and balance of canter; straightness
Regularity and quality of gaits; clear, balanced transition
Moderate lengthening of frame and stride with engagement, elasticity, suspension, straightness and uphill balance

movements.movement: Transitions K and R, Collected trot
movements.directive: Clear, balanced transitions; consistent tempo

movements.movement: Turn left, Turn left, Halt, salute
movements.directive: Bend and balance in turns; engagement, uphill balance and quality of trot; clear, balanced transition; straightness; attentiveness; immobility (min. 3 seconds)

collective_marks.description: Freedom and regularity
Desire to move forward; elasticity of the steps; suppleness of the back; engagement of the hindquarters
Willing cooperation; harmony; attention and confidence; acceptance of bit and aids; straightness; lightness of forehand and ease of movements
Alignment; posture; stability; weight placement; following mechanics of the gaits
Clarity; subtlety; independence; accuracy of test

tests.name: 2023 USEF Second Level Test 2

A greater degree of straightness, suppleness, throughness, and balance are required to perform the movements with ease and self-carriage.

movements.directive: Balanced straight transitions; quality of canter; consistent tempo

coefficient_movements: Collected trot transitions at M and P (movement 7)

collective_marks.description: Freedom and regularity
Desire to move forward; elasticity of the steps; suppleness of the back; engagement of the hindquarters
Willing cooperation; harmony; attention and confidence; acceptance of bit and aids; straightness; lightness of forehand and ease of movements
Alignment; posture; stability; weight placement; following mechanics of the gaits
Clarity; subtlety; independence; accuracy of test

tests.name: 2023 USEF Third Level Test 1

test_info.trot_sitting_requirement: All trot work must be done sitting

tests.purpose: To confirm that the horse demonstrates correct basics, while maintaining consistent uphill balance and self-carriage. Increased engagement facilitates clear differences in collected, medium, and extended gaits with well-defined, balanced transitions. Movements should be accomplished with harmony and ease due to the increased balance and collection. The horse must demonstrate a greater degree of throughness, suppleness, straightness and bending.
tests.introduces: Extended gaits; half pass at trot; single flying change

movements.movement: Enter collected trot, Halt, salute, Proceed collected trot
movements.directive: Engagement, self-carriage and quality of trot; well defined transitions; straightness; attentiveness; immobility (min. 3 seconds)
Angle, bend and balance; engagement and self-carriage

movements.movement: Half circle left 10m, Half pass left
movements.directive: Shape and size of half circle; alignment, bend, fluency and crossing of legs; engagement and self-carriage
Angle, bend and balance; engagement and self-carriage

movements.directive: Shape and size of half circle; alignment, bend, fluency and crossing of legs; engagement and self-carriage
Moderate lengthening of frame and stride with engagement, elasticity, suspension, straightness and uphill balance; consistent tempo; well defined transitions

movements.directive: Immobility, willing steps back with correct rhythm and count; straightness; clear transitions

movements.movement: Change rein, extended walk, Medium walk
movements.directive: Regularity; suppleness of back; activity; overtrack; freedom of shoulder; stretching to the bit; clear transitions

movements.directive: Activity and quality of the preparation and execution, bend, balance, tempo, regularity, and fluency

Alignment and bend while moving fluently forward and sideways; engagement and self-carriage

movements.directive: Clear, balanced, fluent, straight flying change; engagement and self-carriage
Utmost ground cover with lengthening of frame; elasticity; engagement; suspension; straightness and uphill balance

movements.movement: Transitions H and K, Collected canter
movements.directive: Well defined maintaining tempo and balance
Shape and size of circle; bend; engagement and self-carriage

movements.movement: Change rein, flying change of lead between centerline and S
movements.directive: Clear, balanced, fluent, straight flying change; engagement and self-carriage
Well defined, balanced transition; engagement and collection
Utmost ground cover with lengthening of frame; elasticity; engagement; suspension; straightness and uphill balance

movements.movement: Transitions M and K, Collected trot
movements.directive: Well defined maintaining tempo and balance
Bend and balance in turn; engagement, self-carriage and quality of trot; well defined transition; straightness; attentiveness; immobility (min. 3 seconds)

coefficient_movements: Flying change between centerline and R (movement 15)
Flying change between centerline and S (movement 19)

collective_marks.description: Freedom and regularity
Desire to move forward; elasticity of the steps; suppleness of the back; engagement of the hindquarters
Willing cooperation; harmony; attention and confidence; acceptance of bit and aids; straightness; lightness of forehand and ease of movements
Alignment; posture; stability; weight placement; following mechanics of the gaits
Clarity; subtlety; independence; accuracy of test

tests.name: 2023 USEF Fourth Level Test 1

test_info.trot_sitting_requirement: All trot work must be done sitting

tests.purpose: To confirm that the horse demonstrates correct basics, and has developed sufficient throughness, suppleness, balance, and impulsion to perform with ease the exercises at this medium level of difficulty. The horse has established consistent self-carriage and lightness through improved connection, engagement, and collection. The movements and transitions are performed with greater straightness, impulsion, and cadence.
tests.introduces: Collected walk; very collected canter; walk pirouettes; multiple flying changes on diagonal

canter: Multiple single flying changes on diagonal (3 changes)

movements.movement: Enter collected trot, Halt, salute, Proceed collected trot
movements.directive: Engagement, self-carriage and quality of trot; well defined transitions; straightness; attentiveness; immobility (min. 3 seconds)

Alignment, bend, fluency and crossing of legs; engagement and collection

movements.directive: Well defined transitions maintaining tempo and balance

movements.directive: Well defined transitions; engagement and collection throughout; size of circle and bend

tests.name: 2023 USEF Fourth Level Test 2

test_info.trot_sitting_requirement: All trot work must be done sitting

tests.purpose: To confirm that the horse demonstrates correct basics, and has developed sufficient throughness, suppleness, balance, and impulsion to perform with ease the exercises at this medium level of difficulty. The horse has established consistent self-carriage and lightness through improved connection, engagement, and collection. The movements and transitions are performed with greater straightness, impulsion, and cadence.

trot: Half pass right (counter change of hand)

movements.directive: Bend and balance of working pirouette; straightness, regularity, engagement and collection of canter

movements.movement: Change rein, three flying changes of lead every fourth stride
movements.directive: Clear, balanced, fluent, straight flying changes; engagement and quality of canter

movements.movement: On diagonal develop very collected canter, Working pirouette left toward the letter M, Proceed collected canter
movements.directive: Bend and balance of working pirouette; straightness, regularity, engagement and collection of canter
Well defined, balanced transition; engagement and collection

movements.movement: Change rein, extended trot, Collected trot
movements.directive: Utmost ground cover with lengthening of frame, engagement, elasticity, suspension, straightness; well defined transitions maintaining tempo and balance
Bend and balance in turn; engagement, collection and quality of trot; well defined transition; straightness; attentiveness; immobility (min. 3 seconds)

collective_marks.description: Freedom and regularity
Desire to move forward; elasticity of the steps; suppleness of the back; engagement of the hindquarters
Willing cooperation; harmony; attention and confidence; acceptance of bit and aids; straightness; lightness of forehand and ease of movements
Alignment; posture; stability; weight placement; following mechanics of the gaits
Clarity; subtlety; independence; accuracy of test

tests.name: 2023 USEF Fourth Level Test 3

test_info.trot_sitting_requirement: All trot work must be done sitting

tests.purpose: To confirm that the horse demonstrates correct basics, and has developed sufficient throughness, suppleness, balance, and impulsion to perform with ease the exercises at this medium level of difficulty. The horse has established consistent self-carriage and lightness through improved connection, engagement, and collection. The movements and transitions are performed with greater straightness, impulsion, and cadence.
tests.introduces: Tempi changes every third stride; working half-pirouettes in canter

movements.movement: Enter collected canter, Halt, salute, Proceed collected trot
movements.directive: Engagement, collection and quality of gaits; well defined transitions; straightness; attentiveness; immobility (min. 3 seconds)

movements.movement: Track left, Change rein, medium trot, Collected trot
movements.directive: Moderate lengthening of frame and stride with engagement, elasticity, suspension, straightness and uphill balance; consistent tempo; well defined transitions
Angle, bend and balance; engagement and collection
Alignment, bend, fluency and crossing of legs; engagement and collection
Utmost ground cover with lengthening of frame, engagement, elasticity, suspension, straightness and uphill balance

movements.movement: Transitions M and K, Collected trot
movements.directive: Well defined maintaining tempo and balance

movements.movement: Halt, rein back 4 steps and proceed collected trot
movements.directive: Immobility, willing steps back with correct rhythm and count; straightness; well defined transitions
Angle, bend and balance; engagement and collection
Alignment, bend, fluency and crossing of legs; engagement and collection
Quality of transition; Regularity, suppleness of back, activity; collection; self-carriage

movements.movement: Half circle 20m Extended walk, Collected walk
movements.directive: Regularity; suppleness of back; activity; overtrack; freedom of shoulder; stretching to the bit; well defined transitions
Precise, fluent transition; engagement; collection and quality of canter
Moderate lengthening of frame and stride with engagement, elasticity, suspension, straightness and uphill balance; consistent tempo; well defined transitions
Alignment and bend while moving fluently forward and sideways; engagement and self-carriage; shape and size of half circle; positioning; self-carriage

movements.movement: Change rein, Working half-pirouette left approximately 3m in diameter, Proceed collected canter
movements.directive: Size, bend and balance of working pirouette; straightness, regularity, engagement and collection of canter
Clear, balanced, fluent, straight flying change
Alignment and bend while moving fluently forward and sideways; engagement and self-carriage; shape and size of half circles; positioning; self-carriage

movements.movement: Change rein, Working half-pirouette right approximately 3m in diameter, Proceed collected canter
movements.directive: Size, bend and balance of working pirouette; straightness, regularity, engagement and collection of canter
Clear, balanced, fluent, straight flying change

movements.movement: Extended canter, Collected canter and flying change of lead
movements.directive: Utmost ground cover with lengthening of frame, engagement, elasticity, suspension, straightness and uphill balance; well defined transitions; clear balanced, fluent, straight flying change on diagonal

movements.movement: Three flying changes of lead every third stride
movements.directive: Clear, balanced, fluent, straight flying changes; engagement and quality of canter
Bend and balance in turn; engagement, collection and quality of canter; well defined transition; straightness; attentiveness; immobility (min. 3 seconds)

coefficient_movements: Half pass right with half circle (movement 17)

collective_marks.description: Freedom and regularity
Desire to move forward; elasticity of the steps; suppleness of the back; engagement of the hindquarters
Willing cooperation; harmony; attention and confidence; acceptance of bit and aids; straightness; lightness of forehand and ease of movements
Alignment; posture; stability; weight placement; following mechanics of the gaits
Clarity; subtlety; independence; accuracy of test

test_progression.test_1: Introduces collected/medium gaits, shoulder-in, 10m circles at canter, counter canter
test_progression.test_2: Adds travers, half turn on haunches, simple changes
test_progression.test_3: Adds counter canter in serpentine (no change of lead)

test_progression.test_1: Introduces extended gaits, half pass at trot, half pass at canter, single flying changes
test_progression.test_2: Adds renvers, release of reins at canter

introduced_movements: Multiple single flying changes on diagonal
Counter change of hand in trot and canter (Test 2)

test_progression.test_1: Introduces collected walk, very collected canter, walk pirouettes, multiple single changes (3 changes on diagonal)
test_progression.test_2: Adds counter change of hand, 4-tempis, working pirouettes in canter

second_level.focus: Development of collected and medium gaits; beginning lateral work
second_level.new_concepts: Collection, shoulder-in, travers, counter canter, simple changes, half turn on haunches
second_level.walk_requirements: Medium walk, free walk, half turn on haunches (introduced Test 2)
second_level.canter_requirements: Collected and medium canter, 10m circles, counter canter, simple changes (introduced Test 2)

third_level.focus: Extension and increased collection; half pass; flying changes
third_level.new_concepts: Extended gaits, half pass at trot and canter, single flying changes, renvers (Test 2), release of reins (Test 2)
third_level.walk_requirements: Medium walk, extended walk, half turn on haunches
third_level.canter_requirements: Collected, medium, extended canter; half pass; single flying changes

fourth_level.focus: Pirouettes, tempi changes, very high collection
fourth_level.new_concepts: Collected walk, very collected canter, walk pirouettes, tempi changes (4s and 3s), working pirouettes in canter
fourth_level.walk_requirements: Collected walk, extended walk, half pirouettes
fourth_level.canter_requirements: Very collected canter, working pirouettes, tempi changes every 4th stride (Test 2), tempi changes every 3rd stride (Test 3)
fourth_level.bridge_to_fei: Fourth Level serves as direct preparation for FEI Prix St. Georges, which requires 4-tempis, 3-tempis, and half pirouettes in canter
